review: I have never had a bad meal here. The drinks are good, the desserts are amazing, and the food is reliably flavorful.  The service is decent--sometimes you have a very attentive server and sometimes you wait a long time for things, but they seem to have improved over the last few times we've gone.  The only downside is that there is a 30+ minute wait if you arrive after 6 p.m. on a weekend.  And it's inside a mall.

Dirty table, dirty silverware, orders came out wrong or burnt. The manager who was dressed like a coach of a peewee hockey team was a total fool. Our server was rude and disrespectful. We left our food mid meal and walked out, promising never to return.  One thing I can understand is it's the holiday time, they are located in the mall, every employee looks like they wanna have a nervous breakdown, but that attitude quickly trickles down to the customer which in return makes the customer wanna have a nervous breakdown. Get your act together. That's all I can say.

CPK has gone down hill, especially this location! We were seated at a table that wasn't cleaned off. So we sat at the booth waiting for it to be cleaned. The waitress came to greet us and we asked if the table could be wiped off, she quickly apologized. While waiting for our table to get cleaned, we opened up our napkin rolls and every piece of silverware was dirty. We asked for new sets, and she said really, let me look at these. She literally started inspecting the silverware, and didn't take our word for it. What's the point of arguing?  The waitress came back (five minutes later) and said ok here you go. In the meantime, our table was not wiped off, which she quickly did after we reminded her. The manager stopped by our table and apologized for the way things started off. He offered us a complimentary app, which was a very nice gesture. He said for us to check back in with him after our meal, to make sure everything else turned out well.  We ordered the complimentary trio appetizer of spring rolls, and a few of the rolls were burned (see photo). We didn't bother complaining and just dealt with it.  We ordered the Thai crunch salad and the Jamaican jerk pizza. The salad was swimming in dressing and pizza didn't come out as requested.  We ordered the bacon very well done, and the majority of the bacon on the pizza was very undercooked.  We asked for a manager and shared our complaints with him. He apologized, but he was pretty dismissive and ran off quickly. I understand, it's the holidays and the mall is busy, but at least act like you give a damn. I was just surprised that a manager would be wearing a football jersey and a baseball hat during hours of business. Safe to say, this place isn't used to be like it was back in the day.

We came here on Veterans Day for their Veterans Specials for dinner with friends; two of us are Veterans so we were ready to choose selections from their Specials Menu.  Because it is located within Somerset Mall the parking was particularly challenging; we had to circle three floors several times before we found someone leaving. Our friends were already there and had just gotten a table so we walked in and just joined them.  After we ordered drinks (Diet Coke with Lemon for me and my wife wanted to try Cucumber Revival) we studied the menus and I chose a Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza from the Veterans Day Menu and my wife picked a Half Order Roasted Vegetables Salad. Is was quite busy because it was Saturday night as well as Veterans Day but service was quick and and our orders came out very promptly.  Drinks were kept full although we did have to ask for refills a couple times.  The Pizza was very good and the crust had good chew as well as decent crunch and I knew I had made a good choice.  My wife's Grilled Vegetable Salad was grilled and then chilled vegetables served on top of chopped lettuce and my wife loved it! Of course we had no room left for dessert so, maybe next time.  For our first time eating at any CPK, we we enjoyed the dishes and would definitely come back.

I always have a great experience at the California pizza kitchen and this was no different. It was during a Christmas shopping trip and this is located at the Somerset Mall on the Macy's side of the street which is the north side of the street. I got the roasted veggie salad (just the half) and my friend got the barbecue chicken pizza duo with the Caesar salad. We both enjoyed our food and I will definitely make sure I go back again. It was very crowded so service was just so so but I understand the waitress was doing the best she could

I've never had a bad time at this place. They have amazing mojitos in many flavors. My friend got a Jamaican jerk pizza it was really good, seasoning was perfect! I ordered the Asian salad, it had a lot of dressing and I could have gone without the rice noodles but it was a very good salad for the most part, if you're at the mall or in the area check out this place for a pizza, cocktails or a nice lunch combo with would, salad or sandwhich!

This is probably my favorite restaurant in town. If you're going to splurge, this is the place to do it. The service is prompt but gruff, though I'd argue that's part of the rustic pizza house feel. Or waiter, Tom, was helpful for pairing beers with pizza. Everything you've heard is 100% true and then some! Obviously the steak is the main event, and every time I go it's top notch-- juice and perfectly cooked. Don't skip dessert! The house made cheescake is out-of-this-world good, so save room on your main course. If you've read this far that means you didn't realize that I typed Yelp's example review while I waited for my dinner to arrive. What I'm really upset about is that I could have done if during the 40 minute wait time. Although I haven't had the food at this location yet, I have been to this restaurant and the food is quite yummy. As the name suggests, try the pizza. Dessert is good. They do take reservations so if they're being nice that day, call ahead and put your name on the list.  Enjoy!

We sat at the bar because it was packed and a 20+ minute wait. Everything was good until a manager went to places glasses on the counter and her arm pit touched my drink and straw while she was reaching to move glasses forward... WTF gross!! The best was she never apologized she walked away. Food was fast and delicious and the bartender was pleasant. I can't give more than 1 star bc of the Manager's arm pit!!! Disappointing and disgusting I'm tempted to call the Health Department now after watching the pizza guy touch toppings without gloves and toss back onto the pizza

I went here on Black Friday and it's in Somerset so I definitely kept that in mind while writing this review. The wait was long but we expected that. I really like that they don't give you a buzzer, they just text you when your table is ready so you don't have to walk around the mall to kill the time with a buzzer. I've been here a couple times and my favorite thing to get is the California Club pizza with goat cheese and whole grain crust. If I ever decide to venture out of that favorite, the menu has ample options (not just pizza) and a lot of health conscious substitutions easily available, which I really appreciate. The restaurant was decently clean and I think it has a good ambiance. The only things I don't like is that people walking by will literally stare you down if you're eating next to the window but I mean the restaurant is in a mall so what are you gonna do. The second is that all the times I've been here the bathroom doors are literally revolting. They're a misted glass and every time all you can see is tons and tons of greasy handprints.  Our waiter took awhile to greet us and he never gave us the free bread we're supposed to get or the lemons we asked for our waters. However we did have modifications on our dishes and everything came out like we asked. Like I said, it was Black Friday. I'm sure he was doing the best he could. All in all I like this place and it's a go to when I'm at Somerset because it's not ridiculously expensive like every other place there. I'd give it four stars except my boyfriend's gotten food poisoning from there twice. I have not.

CPK is so much more than pizza. They have a nice menu with a wide assortment of food including fresh specialty salads. It had been a while since I visited but I was not disappointed when I last visited.The service was great and even though it was lunchtime I did not have to look around for my server. The food was fresh and full of flavor. It is a little pricey if you only look at the cost but it is very reasonable when you look at the quality of food that you receive. It is located away from the food court in Somerset Mall so you can enjoy a relaxing dining atmosphere. At peak times there can be a wait as they are a very popular place.  I will be back to visit again.

I haven't been to CPK in years. My sister and I tried it for lunch. At first glance of the menu I thought the prices were expensive. I missed the lunch specials on the back of the menu where the prices were a little more reasonable. I ordered the pizza and salad combo and it was about $11- excellent! My sister ordered the spinach dip appetizer which was tasty. I love that they give you bread too. I'll be back!

The wait wasn't long for a Saturday night. But the check in process was awkward. The hostess didn't have a microphone, they weren't giving out beepers and this caused a lot of confusion since you could barely hear the hostesses voice over the loud mall noise.  It was definitely worth the confusion as everything we order was delicious.  One thing I enjoy about CPK is that they are consistent. The BBQ chicken pizza is my favorite. You also can't go wrong with their salads.  Make sure to save room for dessert since they always have a great selection.  If you don't mind sitting at the bar it's a good way to sit down without the wait.
Great pizzia.  I love  this location.  Always great service and good food.  On today the service is kinda lacking.  But I still got my usual.

I loved the variety in the menu and the atmosphere of the restaurant. We were greeted and were checked up on quite frequently. The place was packed because it was lunch time but we still managed to get great service. I ordered soup and salad (I was on a diet, LOL) and my friends ordered their pies. Everything was delicious.  My only downside was the portion sizes. My plate was as wide as a sun hat but had a weird concave bowl part for soup in the middle. *insert confused girl meme here*. They use the illusion of the plate to distract portion size.

Eh  is my official review.   Service was excellent.  Waiter was friendly, fast and nice. Recommended coupon that saved me five dollars.  Dumplings were overcooked. Avocado eggrolls were OK I might neat them again.Guacamole appetizer was also OK but not amazing.   Overall it was a ho-hum experience. Won't be rushing back there

Very disappointing SMALL PORTIONS server here .  I left this Resturant so hungry after I already ate my meal most places I'm always bring some of my meal to take home not here though.  I could have eaten 2 or 3 times what I was served here. I ordered cedar plank salmon the asparagus was cold and most of all the PORTIONS  ARE SMALL best to come here if you want to blow $50.00 on you and a date for a snack sized dinner meal they should Advertise that their menu is a kiddie menu because that's what you get an appetizer sized meal. Next time I'll go to Pieology  and be Full for under $9.00  I should have spend $50.00 on Pieology then I would have went home with 1 pizza in my belly 1 Pizza for my date and 6 Pizzas to take home with us! For a more nicer type Resturant in Somerset Mall you think they'd  shell out for a little more food to be served up.

Overall moderately average. 15 minute wait was a little inconvenient for our hunger. Took tooooooo long to bring bring and water to the table. We were starved and parched. Pizza: okay. Salad: okay. nothing exciting. My taste buds weren't tingling. Overall experience: okay. but if ur hungry after a long day of spending all ur moolah, this is the place.

My first experience here was awesome, the food was great but our server Stephanie was seriously amazing, I felt like I've known her for years, she was so sweet and never let my drink go empty, it's super rare to find such a genuine server now a days that actually care. We will be back!

I'm a first timer here at CK. I ordered a pizza with chicken, lettuce mix, avocado and tomato with a delicious white sauce. I can't remember the name but it is so amazing. Best pizza I've had in my life! My sister got the garlic Alfredo with shrimp and that was delicious as well!  It was my sisters birthday and out Waiter overheard us talking about it and brought out a AMAZING sundae with a candle on top! What a guy. I will 100% eat here every time I come back for a day of shopping at the Somerset!

I hate when people only provide a review on Yelp when things are bad, so let me say this:  I ate at this same CPK in August and we had a fantastic meal.  Great service, excellent food, and a great atmosphere.  My daughter loved it so much that she was anxious to come back, and we relented even though we really didn't want CPK today.   Unfortunately, she wasn't given the opportunity to eat there today because the service was so bad.  After waiting nearly 10 minutes to be seated (even though we were the second group in line and there were many empty tables), we waited at our table for almost 20 minutes.  No one came by.  No one asked about drinks.  And there didn't even appear to be much activity near us in terms of wait staff.  The employees we did see (most of them anyway) weren't hustling, and it was obvious that no one cared about the customer experience today.  We were hesitant to sit after the entry wait, concerned that it would be the same level of service once we sat down. Unfortunately, we were right.  With no one even meandering through our section, we finally gave up and decided to leave rather than start the dining experience nearly 30 minutes after entering the restaurant. There were a number of empty tables.  It wasn't a slow day, to be sure, but it wasn't a mall Saturday, either.  I suspect they just didn't have the staffing to handle the tables, but the answer to that is not to sit people and let them know up front where things stand. Just abysmal service.  My daughter was so sad because she loves the place.  Fortunately, we were able to find a nearby establishment interested in our business.

Disappointing.  Haven't been to one of these in a while so we thought we would try it again. The pizza's were sad, and lacked taste.  We had the California Club..some chunks of bacon and chicken with a bag of lettuce tossed over it and some mushroom thing which was just that...just a pile of sliced mushrooms on a pizza base. Maybe the mall sites are worse than the ones on their own but will bot be returning

Service not great. Sat at the bar during a weekday lunch hour and my water and drinks were not refilled. I was basically ignored most of my visit. They werent that busy either, lots of tables open. Would not recommend.

This was my first visit to California Pizza Kitchen and I had an okay time. At 2pm, we thought we would be able to get a table quickly. This was not the case. Oh well, we waited about 15 min which allowed us time to install the CPK app for a free "small plate". I felt like the service was a little slow here. Our waiter, Travis, was very friendly and patient. After we ordered, we expected to get the complimentary bread soon after. I was starving so I really wanted to eat something quick. However, after waiting for about 15 min, we decided to ask for it. After we did, it came shortly. For our free small plate, we got a shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread. This was the perfect size - four pieces for the four of us. It was quite tasty as well and super cute! We ordered the California club pizza, which is first baked with bacon, chicken, and cheese, and then topped with a salad, basil, and avocado. I found that the basil was too much as they were literally placed almost whole on top. I like basil, though, so it was ok for me, but I can imagine others not feeling the same. I really liked this pizza! We also got a White pizza and added bacon for $1.59. This was also quite good, very cheesy. I found that these pizza crusts got chewy and hard and difficult to eat after it got cold. We also got the fish taco. It only came with 2 tacos, some salsa, and chips. The fish was mahi-mahi and was quite good, obviously good quality fish. The portion was quite small for the price. I love coleslaw though, so this was pretty good for us to share. Overall, food was good and service was good. For a chain restaurant, I would say it met my expectations. I would definitely go again when I'm in the states and they had it somewhere nearby! Cheesecake Factory would be my choice before this place, though. Yay!
Probly the worst pizza I have ever had.   Tasted frozen but the bottom wasn't cooked.

Pretty good pizza? Been wanting to try for years. I would not have to go back as there are other places with much better pizza. Convenience is probably the biggest draw to this place? Just drop in while shopping & you don't even have to leave the mall? We had the Spinach & Artichoke Dip, the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad & the Sicilian Pizza, all of which were good. Their housemade ranch dressing was AWESOME! Place was decently clean. Service was OUTSTANDING! Katie was our server & just done a PHENOMENAL job! $lightly OVERpriced, for quality, but I gue$$ you have to pay for that convenience?

The food is typically good and I truly appreciate a restaurant that makes allergen information available to customers because my son is allergic to eggs. However, I only give 4 stars because of the inability to bring strollers into the restaurant. With strollers being as expensive as they are, I don't feel comfortable leaving mine unattended outside of the restaurant. I understand asking people to fold the strollers, but I should be able to keep it near my table.

I'm not a big fan of restaurant chains but CPK is the exception. I've been to multiple locations across the country and CPK is always consistently good, clean, and friendly. This location was no different. The hummus is the best appetizer, it's always good. Their tortilla soup is warming to the soul but not too spicy. And the roasted veggie salad is one of my all time favorite salads ever. It's full of chunky, flavor, and veggies. I think it's reasonably priced, good drinks as well, and friendly staff.

It's a very busy CPK. There's a long 20-25 min wait that you have to put your name in for. It's like that most weekends.  The good thing is that it's in a mall and you can occupy yourself with other things. They started a new system that texts and calls you when the table is ready so it makes it much nicer. It's an updated store since it's a pilot location. For food I normally get the jambalaya or the Kung pao spaghetti. Both are good not great. A bit too much overpowering flavor on both. The pizzas are good but I do t find them filling enough for me. Prices feel a bit high for the value you get, but maybe they are going for a more upscale price point. My major annoyance with CPK is the bread. First you have to ask to get it served. Then they give about one slice of a baguette per person. I want bread, not bread crumbs! Aside from that though, the restaurant is always busy for good reason. The food is solid and the location can't be beat.

I love CPK, and I know my bf and everybody else thinks I'm crazy, but I really do love it!!! Pros: -chicken tequila fettucine: SOOOO good. -spinach artichoke dip: the best I've ever had. -they offer coke products! -great service: today, my party of 1 (haha, so sad. I didn't know the mall opened til 12pm on Sundays.. -_-) dined at the bar, where Jenny kept me company and made some light conversation with me.  I always love talking to people, so I really enjoyed the company :) She was also prompt to refill my drink take my order. -I don't know if I'm crazy or what (or maybe just perpetually homesick), but I love looking at the artwork/pix on the wall...I honestly think at least 1-2 of them are images taken in San Diego! Cons: -this is an overall CPK con, not this particular location, but portion sizes have decreased dramatically since I started dining at CPK. -very busy location, so you may have a long wait, but just plan accordingly -they don't really give out much bread.  This isn't a biggie for me bc I don't like to eat the bread anyways..it's filler food, people!
This has always been one of my favorite restaurant chains. I'v been going there for over  15 years and there isn't much that I don't like on the menu. I highly recommend CPK to everyone.

Not the best visit we've ever had. I have been to this location many any times. Usually the service is great. Our servers in the past have been quite attentive, checks in to see if we need anything during the meal, after the meal. Grabs dishes that have piled up. Refills on drinks.  You know the drill. On Sunday we had Mary. Now while she was friendly and helpful in taking our orders there seemed to be a lacking component of follow up. The kids meals came first. My mom ordered a salad and I had soup. It took a full 20+ minutes before our items came to the table. By then the kids were done eating their pasta. She noticed their drinks were empty at that point but made no special trip in between to see if we needed anything or to even let us know about the delay in our meals. Once we were done we sat there. We watched people come and go. We watched people being served. But Mary was everywhere else. Anywhere else. We finally had to flag her down to order dessert and get our check. I still had to ask her to remove some of the excess plates on the table. This is not typical by any means. We have eaten here many many times as I've said before and never experienced slow service or a server who has forgotten us. Yes we've been here during madhouse busy hours as well as low peak hours. This was just not our best experience.
Great food. OK prices. Friendly service. Wait times can be a little long even when doing carry out. It nice that you can call ahead and just pick up though.

So I have waited for two weeks to write this review to give them a fair chance. I had ordered a takeout where I specifically told them (multiple times) to leave the chicken out when making the salad (which btw costs 15 bucks for god knows what). Looks like the chef forgot and put it in anyway and at the last moment removed it. When I opened it, there were little pieces of chicken in it. This has happened to me in other places and I understand that not many people ask to leave the meat out. When I called the manager, he refused to cancel the order (the other places have offered to do that) and would only allow me to pick up another one. On top of that he definitely was talking down to me like I was lying or something. I did not have the time to go back and he said he will drop in a gift card instead and took down my address. Two weeks later, I am still waiting for my gift card and paid $15 for food I could not eat. Their ethics sucks and I will never go back.

Excellent food in every CPK I've ever been to.. The menu is creative and has a wide variety of tasty bites. The service at this location is also great. However, the tables are too close to each other and it is always busy.. Wait times...  My favorite meal is the BBQ chicken chopped salad or the Spicy Chipotle chicken pizza.  They also have nice mixed drinks and martinis. I did try the Carnitas tacos once and they were dry and unsatisfying..  I do believe this was a rare occasion but wouldn't order them again. I feel the menu is also a little overpriced.  Overall.. One of my favorite places to eat!

I have not been here in years but I was surprised they still have really good food. I had the roasted vegetable salad with chicken and it was really good. The perfect portion size too.  Service was kind of slow considering they were not busy.  Drinks are pricey.

Had dinner here with my wife. Got seated quickly and service was very prompt, except that they forgot the bread at first. We had the Thai salad and the California vege pizza. The salad was excellent, the peanut butter dressing was very tasty and everything felt fresh and crunchy. The pizza was great too, especially loved the corn. It could have used a little more seasoning though. Otherwise great dinner at CPK.

I havent been to a cpk in 3-4 years and i heard they made it more upscale. I was never a big fan but I once had a gf who was really into the tostada pizza so we would eat it from time to time. While the interior is certainly much nicer, gone are the ugly 80's lemon yellow paint and in is the new sleek rustic wood nightclub look.   However the pizza is garbage. I will preface it by saying after a trip to naples a couple years ago my pizza palette was refined. There are two categories; good and basically frozen s$@!. CPK falls into the later, the tostada tasted like taco bell leftovers thrown on a slice of bread. Basically vomit in my mouth. The only saving grace was they has a salted carmel pudding dessert that was pretty good and there was a waitress that is an incredible doppelgänger for Kristen Stewart that I could not keep my eyes off of.

My bf & I were seated immediately around dinner time because we weren't a large group. There was a large group waiting to be seated outside when we arrived, though. The service was fine, and the food was standard CPK food. I did notice that the prices seemed a bit steeper than other CPK's I've been to. Ah well, I guess that's Somerset for you.

Please go to CPK immediately and order a bowl of the Farmers Market Soup (a wonderful squash based veggie medley). Yes, yes - the name is bad and a bit cliche but overlook it and order. It was the best soup I've had in years.  Squash soup with carrots, corn and other fine vegetable friends. Mmmmmmmm nutrients.  Oh and of course the pizza was fine. The service was fine and the total cost was just a bit too much.  That's how it goes at CPK.

We came on Valentine's Day, so we expected it to be crowded. Only a 20 minute wait and then we got seated. I had a Raspberry Lemon Martini, which was the strongest drink I've EVER had. And on an empty stomach? Whoa... We started with the Waldorf Salad and it was delicious, especially the sweet glazed pecans. I had the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine and it was sooo good! Crisp tender ribbons of zucchini and yummy shrimp. A pasta dish at a restaurant for 550 calories? Yep.  He had the Hawaiian pizza which was good but not great. A little too charred on the bottom. Service was good, but not great. We will be back.

I love coming here with friends. The food comes out fast. My only complaint is that sometimes it can get a little too salty -- especially the jambalaya shrimp pasta.  The pizza you can probably finish by yourself, but if you want to split it with a friend, it's doable as well.  I love that they partner with schools for fundraisers.

Best CPK in the greater Detroit area. Food is always prompt and fresh. This place is a favorite for families as the kids meals are a great value, especially with the deserts. If you appreciate good service, Sean will take great care of you.

Best location and plenty of room. This CPK location also has seating with the Mall view and it is amusing to sit there savoring your soup while watching kids run around . The Pizza is in the name but their Soups and Salads are the best. Don't miss the appetizers also called small plates.

The bread they give at the beginning is so tasty. I've been eating here couple of times, the waitress was really nice and took my order really carefully since I'm really picky with what's on my food. It took about 20minutes to get it, it was worth the wait! If you ever been in Italy, this restaurant is a lot similar!

I've been going to this California Pizza Kitchen for about 9 years now, and I have never been disappointed. The wait staff is always friendly, the menu has a good variety of dishes, and the prices are reasonable. My only complaint is that this is a pretty popular restaurant in Somerset so often there is a 25/30 minute wait on the weekends, but the quality of the dining experience makes up for that. The restaurant is family-friendly and overall, the atmosphere is great.

ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS...all seven of us Loved our meal!!  My chopped Italian salad (substituted with Caesar dressing) heavenly...kids loved the chicken tender circles and broccolini...THE SERVER 'LIZ"was attentive and knowledgeable...and kind..,manager really stepped up by turning the AC down...a perfect Lunch

Yum in my tum.  And meh. Yum : the salad selection.  Omg it is awesome.  For a Thai salad there is lots of toppings and yum salad dressing.  Service is ultra efficient.  Manager said hello.  Hostess said goodbye.  All systems were go tonight. Meh : hubbies pizza was ehhh, and they supposedly rock at the pizza thing....  Very very expensive for pizza and salad.  Very.  Go there expecting a pizza joint, not a somerset nice restaurant.

Great job with service, seating, and management.  Super friendly staff, everyone was on top of everything, friendly host, quick seating, great waiter (good job Kyle, good service has been tough to find lately).  Pretty good pizza.   The only real knock is the their portion sizes.  The size of their "original" pizza has seemingly gotten smaller.  I could have easily ate the whole thing by myself, where I used to split one with a friend and be satisfied. Chicken club pizza was pretty good, but I prefer the BBQ chicken.

I've always enjoyed CPK food.  But never have I had such an attentive and polite and smiley waiter!!  The guy that served us tonight should enter a contest for best waiters in the midwest.  This guy went above and beyond for my sister, her husband, and their baby.  He has blond hair but we forgot his name!

I only went here to take advantage of an American Express cash back offer.  I think it was something like spend $25 and get $10 back.  I wasn't too impressed overall and I don't think I would be back unless someone else was paying for it. The food itself is very mediocre.  I know I shouldn't expect much from a national chain like this, but I still ended up being disappointed.  The pizzas are small and expensive.  It was average at best.   The service was slow and crappy, and I really don't feel it was our server's fault.  It is clear to me that CPK values table turnover above anything else.  The moment any party would get up to leave, the bussers would swarm the table like locusts and get it prepared for the next group who was seated immediately.  This process seriously took less than 30 seconds.  This would be all fine and dandy if the servers and floor manager actually paid attention to the people who were already seated.  Unfortunately once you're seated, they no longer care. It took a while to get greeted by our server due to his section being hopelessly over-sat.  He didn't have time to wipe his ass, let alone pay enough attention to us. My girlfriend ordered a wine sampler, and the wine glasses were dirty.  One of them had a big gross lipstick print on the rim.  It didn't even look like the glass was washed. When we unrolled our silverware it looked pretty rough too.  We tried to flag down our server, but he was visibly overwhelmed and speedwalking from table to table.  We saw a manager talking to a group of bussers, presumably cracking the whip to increase table turnover.  When she walked by our table, we tried to flag her down as well.  She just kept walking and we never saw her again.  Eventually our server came back to check on us, and we informed him of our filthy glassware/silverware.  He apologized and quickly replaced it for us. In the end the server was able to get a manager to remove one of our appetizers from our total.  While that is a nice gesture, it's not enough to convince me to come back.  It's obvious to me where CPK's priorities lie, and it's not on customer service or food quality. Next time I'm at Somerset and I want Pizza, I would rather go to Sbarro.

I only was here on the last visit because friends insisted we go to this location.   I remember the long, long, long waits we've had here before so I kept my fingers crossed. CPK as a chain is not bad and I'd give them 4 stars.  The portions are very small but they offer interesting toppings on the pizzas particularly (such as pear or artichoke).  Plus I love how I recently noticed on the menu that they have posted detailed information for vegetarians and vegans ( ), allergen information ( ), gluten free options ( ), and nutritional information ( ).   This is EXCELLENT and SO HELPFUL.  I think more restaurants should do this. It does state that there may be some variance between locations so I always still ask.  At this location, the waitress seemed to have no clue about what could be vegetarian.  Honestly, she seemed uninterested in helping.  I stuck to a salad which was sad.  I don't know if the information on the website was available then but I could have used it.  She should definitely have known more.  For comparison purposes at the Farmington Hills location at least they tried to help.  Not only should she have known more, her service was so slow.  She only checked for refills of water once and asked how our food was once.  We were there for one-and-a-half hours most of which was waiting! I know this location is busy but service was slow at the other location mentioned too (Farmington Hills).  I really hope that improves.  Still, I'm very happy that this is one chain that has gone out of its way to work with vegans and vegetarians.  Hopefully the cheeses listed are free of rennet and hopefully a vegan cheese option makes its way onto the menu too.  Thank you (as a chain) for at least for providing such detailed information.

I have been to this particular restaurant dozens of times. I would've given my service a 3 or 4 star rating, but today when I visited I felt almost annoyed about my experience. My mother and I walked in and was able to pick our spots by the bar. The second we sat our purses on the counter and was barely on our seats, the waiter asked what drinks we wanted. He quickly grabbed the drinks and about 1 minute into our visit he asked us what we would like. I politely asked for more time to look through the menu. Mind you, the restaurant wasn't particularly busy yet this bartender/waiter was being a bit pushy. After ordering, as my mom and I were sitting there enjoying each other's company, I hear our waiter obnoxiously holler to a cook that I had a nut allergy, which I had told him when I ordered my food. I am almost sure that everyone in the restaurant heard him. He apologized but I was still a bit ticked. Time passed, and our waiter and a few of his coworkers were joking about how another coworker has the tendency to never pay for his food. They started harassing that employee in a funny matter. I thought it was funny at first but the employees got so loud it was very distracting! Almost immature. Eventually the food came out, and as my mom was in the bathroom when her plate arrived, the waiter asked me to press my finger on the pizza she ordered to make sure it wasn't cold. Like, wtf? California Pizza Kitchen more like Pizza probably shipped from California  and put into a freezer for months. Now that really irritated me, but as a frequent customer I was even more appalled when the waiter came out with a cup of my tortilla soup, which is usually boiling hot and filled to the rim. This time, I was given a Lukewarm 1/4 filled cup of soup, took me about 30 seconds to eat. I'm just so sad because that restaurant is usually our go-to lunch place when we are at the mall, now I'm not sure I want to go back :/

Stopped here for lunch the other day. I had never been to a CPK before and honestly it was pretty good. Had a couple fish tacos and some jerk chicken pizza. I've had better fish tacos but they were good anyway. The pizza was excellent and I'm interested to try some of the others on the menu. They seem to have some really unique pizzas that I don't think you could get elsewhere. The service was a little slow on drinks and refills but not so bad I would complain about it.

I would never come here unless I was already at Somerset and even then, it's for the convenience factor of not having to trek to the South end.  Getting seated immediately happens almost never. The wait is always 15 minutes for more. You would think by now they'd figure out a buzzer system so people can pop in to nearby shops, but nope. Your entire party must be there when your name is called, which is hard enough to hear anyway if you're waiting because it's so loud. As for the food, it always sounds better than it actually is. I've had other pizzas before but I can't recall what. Our meat cravers is a crispy thin crust. Good luck eating a slice without having all the ingredients fall because the crust isn't thick enough to hold the Italian sausage, bacon (both very skimy), pepperoni, ham and salami. The ingredients were small bits of meat, but the sausage was not. Seriously, they all kept rolling off! It also could use a more sauce. The field greens salad in a dijon balsamic vinaigrette was the best part. An abundance of fresh greens, with pears and walnuts that provided a balance of savory, sweet and juicy. For the cost of this place, they could a lot better overall.

Okay place to go to..but you need to take it in context. If I was meeting up with friends or needed someone to take my imaginary kids (pretend 30yr old mom from troy) then I would drag them to CPK no doubt. They can manage kids there and no one cares if they are screaming. There are long waits but they try to seat you as soon as possible and the hours they are open are much longer than mall house. Prices are the same as any other CPK but you are paying for location and you might not want ot shell out for jalexs or capitale grill or drag them to the food court.Personal pizzas are good, I like their hummus, sandwiches with salad good/overpriced but good, their service can vary based on the people in general. Watch out for the screaming kids...applies if they are yours or the ones next table over screaming.
Love the pea soup. Service was pleasant.  This was my first time here I'll be back. Very convenient location.  I wish the tables had more room, we were a bit crowded on a booth

It's California Pizza Kitchen, but I rarely ever have pizza there...my favorite dish there is the Sedona soup ...supper yummy !!  There is food is good in general, the prices are decent, and the service is ok.

To anyone who has read my reviews in the past, it's easy to figure out that I'm not much of a fan of chain restaurants.  And, to a certain extent, that applies to CPK. Not that the food is bad here, it just is never as good as you think it should be (something that I find to hold true for most chain restaurants--even more expensive ones).  I had that new Habenaro Pulled Pork pizza, which, I gotta admit, was quite good, although not as good as the menu made it seem (maybe they just hire brilliant menu writers at these places??).   Also, I wish they would give an option for smaller, lunch portions.  My girlfriend and I came here for lunch, but I'm pretty sure we ordered off the same menu that is used for dinner.  Both of us were stuffed after eating not even half of our pizza, and, although it made for pretty decent leftovers, I would have preferred to pay maybe $3-4 less for smaller portion.  Maybe even more of a "personal" pizza and small salad combo or something.  While I'm not going to hate on CPK, just be prepared to spend about $15-20 per person on food that will almost assuredly not blow you away.

Anytime, my husband comes to Detroit to visit we always either head over to Supino's of CPK! For awhile, we were even into the frozen CPK pizzas. The pizza we order that is delicious is called The Works, pepperoni, sausage, onion, peppers...the list goes on. For being a franchise, it's good quality and awfully tasty.

it wasn't an accident - two times in a row I got an amazing Cobb Salad - carryout.  Normally a Cobb salad is chop up some head lettuce and throw whatever is in the kitchen is on the lettuce. Who ever prepares their Cobb pays attention and does a fabulous job. All the ingredients are fresh and well proportioned.  They just don't throw on some pepperoncini or red onion to try and make it taste good, Normally I get bread with a carryout - my neighbors birds get most of it.  I COULD HAVE HAD MORE and they give you a nice olive oil/fresh basil dipping sauce.  YUM. Will definitely do again and again - thank you. Tonight I opted for soups - potato was good - Farmer's wasn't to my liking.  Tortilla - too much corn.  Was cream based. BREAD SUCKED.  How things change in a couple years.

Ho hum are the two words to describe this restaurant and their food. I ordered the Korean BBQ taco appetizer and it was terrible. The tiny pieces of steak were tougher than shoe leather (as was the flour tortilla they served it in.) The sauce had some heat to it which was nice but the flavor was so overwhelmingly soy sauce that it just tasted bitter. My husband liked the lettuce wrap appetizer he ordered. He was kind of irked that it came unassembled.  I ordered the Tostada pizza with lime chicken per Yelpers recommendation. The crust was more like a fried chalupa rather than pizza crust and I didn't like it. The chicken was so puny that I dug through the mess on top just to make sure it was in there. The toppings were okay but again I wish it had pizza crust.  My husband had the pear gorgonzola thin crust pizza and said it was just okay. He said the pesto chicken pizza is much better. We ate here on a Saturday night around 8 pm and the place was packed. We were told the wait was 20-25 minutes but actually waited 40 minutes.  I'm going to stick with Crispelli's for good brick oven pizza with thick tasty crust and fresh delicious toppings. This place? Not so much.

90% of the time the service is great. I work close by and sometimes like to grab a pizza on lunch. The plan seems great but in that 10% of time service isn't great I can't get back to work on time.  It California pizza kitchen so the reputation may have proceeded the review but the food is good. A pizza is big enough to split and the topping options and speciality pizzas make going back worth it.  Definitely try it out!

Okay it's four stars for a pizza joint. But I keep coming back. The asparagus and arugula salad as part of the new menu is amazing. I don't know why they keep taking the rosemary chicken pizza off the menu, it is my favorite. Other than that I like the barbecue chicken pizza, the Santa Fe pizza, and the Margherita pizza. I love the chicken Caesar sandwich and for dinner the breaded chicken cutlet with arugula.  Overall everything is good, how can you not like a pizza place.

I've been to california pizza kitchen at somerset many times. The service is always great, the atmosphere a little unpleasant. The tables are very crowded and there are a million people there during lunch and dinner, the restaurant seems to echo a little bit and there doesn't seem to be good sound absorption. I mean if you don't care about loudness you'll be totally fine but it get's on my nerves sometimes. CPK offers many tasty and pricey dishes. My favorite is the thai chicken pizza. Overall yummy stuff if you don't mind spending $16 for a lunch (pop & a pizza). Their 6 slice pizza is enough for most people to eat and bring 1-3 slices home, it's a little iffy to split. I mean I am a normal weight 20 something girl and I eat 4 slices most days.  Their brownie dessert is SO yummy, I recommend it. Also the mac n' cheese is really good and they've made an adult sized bowl of it when I've asked which is really nice of them. I honestly would give this place 4 stars if it wasn't so crowded and loud, but I guess they can't help it with it being in the mall like that.

I love this place! It took me awhile to get on the CPK bandwagon. I wasn't impressed with the pepperoni pizza, the three meat was just ok, and the BBQ chicken was not my forte.  It wasn't until I tried the chicken tostada pizza that I fell in love. Warm pizza bread topped with Cheddar cheese, lettuce, salsa, chicken and tortilla chips make for a crunchy, yummy treat. I also enjoy their piping hot tortilla soup (also served with tortilla strips) and a host of other mouth watering flavors.  The lettuce wraps or spinach dip make for a nice starter and they have a host of delicious desserts from which to choose. They also have drinks galore, offering a full bar and many flavorful lemonades to choose from.  This location can get pretty crowded, so you can grab a pager, do a little shopping and come back for your meal. Or call ahead and get your pizza to go!

OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! This is my fav restaurant!! They are trendy and taste great and I would order any pizza with the optional honey wheat dough.      The design is clean, I have never had a bad meal or server.  If all tables are taken, you can sit at the bar and watch the chefs make all the food.       Their tortilla soup is the best I've had.  I've tried most appetizers, salads and more than half their pizzas (BBQ ckn is BEST) and I want to try a sandwich but I love the others so much I can't stray :D     They servers are very well trained and not just anyone can work here.  The wait for a table is worth it if they are busy, which happens at peak times b/c they are consistent with quality.      SO AWESOME!!!!
I love this place! You do want to go in knowing there may be a wait time since it is in a mall. The staff is very friendly and brings my food in a timely manner. The perfect break from shopping. :)

While I have occasionally had and occasionally enjoyed the pizza at CPK, I have to second Rebecca B.'s review in that the salad selection is quite delicious.  During a recent trip to Somerset, my mom and I decided to pop in for a quick lunch and I have to say, I was delightfully surprised to enjoy my roasted vegetable salad - really good!!!  So much so that I'd replicate it if I could!!!  Mom had the caramelized peach salad, also good.... aaaaaannnnddd she may have written down the quinoa salad ingredients and made it for dinner - also delicious!!!
Service was just ok and the food gave me a stomach ache.

Not like any other Pizza Restaurant, this place sells specialty pizza such as Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant, White Pizza, Thai Chicken, Italian Tomato & Basil, The Greek Pizza and many other selections. They also serve Spaghetti- very delicious.  They usually put peanut sauce in the noodle so make sure you don't have allergy.  They have many selection of drinks and beers.  This place usually gets very busy around dinner time.  The wait can be from 15 minutes up to an hour during the weekend. Overall, the service is good and the staffs are friendly.

It's a chain and it's in the north side of the Somerset Place mall.  The prices are pretty high.  But wait.  What can you find that's decent in a mall?  The pizza, although of the yuppie variety isn't bad and the salads are good.  Just watch out for the lines to get in and there is really no nice place to wait while you are on line.

Yes, it's a mall store, and yes, it's a chain, but, the funny thing is, the BBQ chicken pizza is REALLY good. The service was pretty good....the waitress was quick and friendly. p.s. the hot fudge brownie sundae is fabulous!!

We decided to try California Pizza Kitchen after all the hype about it, sadly we were disappointed.  Even though the restaurant was busy we were seated right away, unfortunately that's when everything went down hill.  We had to wait over 10 minutes for a waitress to come take our drink order. After about another 10 minutes we received our sodas.  When she tried explaining there specials to us, she was pretty much whispering and looking at the ceiling and everywhere around her.  when we finally got our food, Rachel's Cesar salad was actually warm, and the cheese on my ravioli was starting to harden.

A pleasant surprise. I usually avoid the chain restaurants, but we were at Somerset and hungry so we decided to give it a go. The server was awesome, but all the kids (Sunday afternoon) and their inept helicopter parents were obnoxious.

My 13yr old son and I stopped here for dinner tonight while at the Somerset Collection.  I've been here numerous times, and have generally had good meals here.  But this time CPK really impressed me.  We ordered the Dynamite Shrimp for an app., which both of us enjoyed.  Not particularly spicy, but tasty.  I had the new-ish Habenaro Carnita pizza (pulled pork, red onions, cheese, cilantro over pesto spread w/ spicy sauce on the side) and he had BBQ Chicken Hawaiian pizza.  After finishing our starter, we sat talking for maybe 10 minutes until my son commented the pizza was taking a bit longer than usual.  Not absurdly long mind you, but slightly longer than expected.  Just then, our waiter Jeffery came by and apologized for the wait, mentioning that our pizza had burned, and they were making new ones.  Within minutes a woman I presume was the manager brought our pies, and apologized for the wait.  She then told us both pizzas were on the house!  I can't recall the last time a restaurant pulled 1 main course off my bill after a (slight) wait, let alone 2.  A comped dessert yes, but this is the type of customer service I thought was long gone.  Kudos to CPK for going the extra mile!  By the way, we both thoroughly enjoyed our pizzas, and still would've even if I'd paid full price for them.

So far so good. I've tried numerous things like chipotle chicken, vegetarian pizza, and etc. The vegetarian pizza is probably the best vegetarian dish I've ever had. The service is good and the food comes out pretty fast. The only thing I recommend is to make a reservation, because it's usually packed with people!
I really love there pizza and there service is the best I would go 100 times more.
Best pizza I've had in my life, Meat Craver's was great every time. My only quarrel is with their selections, as their wine is lacking and they have only exotic appetizers. Still great.

I have been here many times in the past, the last time about a year and a half ago.  Since my last visit they changed the recipe for the Thai Chicken Pizza.  I will just say the new pizza is not nearly as good as the old one.  Overall the restaurant was very good, I just did not care for the new recipe.

Another one of my absolute favorite chain restaurants, and this just happens to be the location I've eaten at a lot.  The service here is great and I recommend sitting at the bar when you're in a hurry over lunch break.  You can order off the regular menu here and the bar tender/server is right at hand.  I recommend the BBQ chicken chopped salad and the santa fe pizza.  The tortilla soup is a good starter.  The thai chicken or margharita pizzas are also delicious as well as the Waldorf chicken salad.  The few items I want to try are the goat cheese pizza and the tricolore salad pizza.  I'll keep you posted on the verdict.

I have never had a bad meal here. The drinks are good, the desserts are amazing, and the food is reliably flavorful.  The service is decent--sometimes you have a very attentive server and sometimes you wait a long time for things, but they seem to have improved over the last few times we've gone.  The only downside is that there is a 30+ minute wait if you arrive after 6 p.m. on a weekend.  And it's inside a mall.

Dirty table, dirty silverware, orders came out wrong or burnt. The manager who was dressed like a coach of a peewee hockey team was a total fool. Our server was rude and disrespectful. We left our food mid meal and walked out, promising never to return.  One thing I can understand is it's the holiday time, they are located in the mall, every employee looks like they wanna have a nervous breakdown, but that attitude quickly trickles down to the customer which in return makes the customer wanna have a nervous breakdown. Get your act together. That's all I can say.

CPK has gone down hill, especially this location! We were seated at a table that wasn't cleaned off. So we sat at the booth waiting for it to be cleaned. The waitress came to greet us and we asked if the table could be wiped off, she quickly apologized. While waiting for our table to get cleaned, we opened up our napkin rolls and every piece of silverware was dirty. We asked for new sets, and she said really, let me look at these. She literally started inspecting the silverware, and didn't take our word for it. What's the point of arguing?  The waitress came back (five minutes later) and said ok here you go. In the meantime, our table was not wiped off, which she quickly did after we reminded her. The manager stopped by our table and apologized for the way things started off. He offered us a complimentary app, which was a very nice gesture. He said for us to check back in with him after our meal, to make sure everything else turned out well.  We ordered the complimentary trio appetizer of spring rolls, and a few of the rolls were burned (see photo). We didn't bother complaining and just dealt with it.  We ordered the Thai crunch salad and the Jamaican jerk pizza. The salad was swimming in dressing and pizza didn't come out as requested.  We ordered the bacon very well done, and the majority of the bacon on the pizza was very undercooked.  We asked for a manager and shared our complaints with him. He apologized, but he was pretty dismissive and ran off quickly. I understand, it's the holidays and the mall is busy, but at least act like you give a damn. I was just surprised that a manager would be wearing a football jersey and a baseball hat during hours of business. Safe to say, this place isn't used to be like it was back in the day.

We came here on Veterans Day for their Veterans Specials for dinner with friends; two of us are Veterans so we were ready to choose selections from their Specials Menu.  Because it is located within Somerset Mall the parking was particularly challenging; we had to circle three floors several times before we found someone leaving. Our friends were already there and had just gotten a table so we walked in and just joined them.  After we ordered drinks (Diet Coke with Lemon for me and my wife wanted to try Cucumber Revival) we studied the menus and I chose a Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza from the Veterans Day Menu and my wife picked a Half Order Roasted Vegetables Salad. Is was quite busy because it was Saturday night as well as Veterans Day but service was quick and and our orders came out very promptly.  Drinks were kept full although we did have to ask for refills a couple times.  The Pizza was very good and the crust had good chew as well as decent crunch and I knew I had made a good choice.  My wife's Grilled Vegetable Salad was grilled and then chilled vegetables served on top of chopped lettuce and my wife loved it! Of course we had no room left for dessert so, maybe next time.  For our first time eating at any CPK, we we enjoyed the dishes and would definitely come back.

I always have a great experience at the California pizza kitchen and this was no different. It was during a Christmas shopping trip and this is located at the Somerset Mall on the Macy's side of the street which is the north side of the street. I got the roasted veggie salad (just the half) and my friend got the barbecue chicken pizza duo with the Caesar salad. We both enjoyed our food and I will definitely make sure I go back again. It was very crowded so service was just so so but I understand the waitress was doing the best she could

I've never had a bad time at this place. They have amazing mojitos in many flavors. My friend got a Jamaican jerk pizza it was really good, seasoning was perfect! I ordered the Asian salad, it had a lot of dressing and I could have gone without the rice noodles but it was a very good salad for the most part, if you're at the mall or in the area check out this place for a pizza, cocktails or a nice lunch combo with would, salad or sandwhich!

This is probably my favorite restaurant in town. If you're going to splurge, this is the place to do it. The service is prompt but gruff, though I'd argue that's part of the rustic pizza house feel. Or waiter, Tom, was helpful for pairing beers with pizza. Everything you've heard is 100% true and then some! Obviously the steak is the main event, and every time I go it's top notch-- juice and perfectly cooked. Don't skip dessert! The house made cheescake is out-of-this-world good, so save room on your main course. If you've read this far that means you didn't realize that I typed Yelp's example review while I waited for my dinner to arrive. What I'm really upset about is that I could have done if during the 40 minute wait time. Although I haven't had the food at this location yet, I have been to this restaurant and the food is quite yummy. As the name suggests, try the pizza. Dessert is good. They do take reservations so if they're being nice that day, call ahead and put your name on the list.  Enjoy!

We sat at the bar because it was packed and a 20+ minute wait. Everything was good until a manager went to places glasses on the counter and her arm pit touched my drink and straw while she was reaching to move glasses forward... WTF gross!! The best was she never apologized she walked away. Food was fast and delicious and the bartender was pleasant. I can't give more than 1 star bc of the Manager's arm pit!!! Disappointing and disgusting I'm tempted to call the Health Department now after watching the pizza guy touch toppings without gloves and toss back onto the pizza

I went here on Black Friday and it's in Somerset so I definitely kept that in mind while writing this review. The wait was long but we expected that. I really like that they don't give you a buzzer, they just text you when your table is ready so you don't have to walk around the mall to kill the time with a buzzer. I've been here a couple times and my favorite thing to get is the California Club pizza with goat cheese and whole grain crust. If I ever decide to venture out of that favorite, the menu has ample options (not just pizza) and a lot of health conscious substitutions easily available, which I really appreciate. The restaurant was decently clean and I think it has a good ambiance. The only things I don't like is that people walking by will literally stare you down if you're eating next to the window but I mean the restaurant is in a mall so what are you gonna do. The second is that all the times I've been here the bathroom doors are literally revolting. They're a misted glass and every time all you can see is tons and tons of greasy handprints.  Our waiter took awhile to greet us and he never gave us the free bread we're supposed to get or the lemons we asked for our waters. However we did have modifications on our dishes and everything came out like we asked. Like I said, it was Black Friday. I'm sure he was doing the best he could. All in all I like this place and it's a go to when I'm at Somerset because it's not ridiculously expensive like every other place there. I'd give it four stars except my boyfriend's gotten food poisoning from there twice. I have not.

CPK is so much more than pizza. They have a nice menu with a wide assortment of food including fresh specialty salads. It had been a while since I visited but I was not disappointed when I last visited.The service was great and even though it was lunchtime I did not have to look around for my server. The food was fresh and full of flavor. It is a little pricey if you only look at the cost but it is very reasonable when you look at the quality of food that you receive. It is located away from the food court in Somerset Mall so you can enjoy a relaxing dining atmosphere. At peak times there can be a wait as they are a very popular place.  I will be back to visit again.

I haven't been to CPK in years. My sister and I tried it for lunch. At first glance of the menu I thought the prices were expensive. I missed the lunch specials on the back of the menu where the prices were a little more reasonable. I ordered the pizza and salad combo and it was about $11- excellent! My sister ordered the spinach dip appetizer which was tasty. I love that they give you bread too. I'll be back!

The wait wasn't long for a Saturday night. But the check in process was awkward. The hostess didn't have a microphone, they weren't giving out beepers and this caused a lot of confusion since you could barely hear the hostesses voice over the loud mall noise.  It was definitely worth the confusion as everything we order was delicious.  One thing I enjoy about CPK is that they are consistent. The BBQ chicken pizza is my favorite. You also can't go wrong with their salads.  Make sure to save room for dessert since they always have a great selection.  If you don't mind sitting at the bar it's a good way to sit down without the wait.
Great pizzia.  I love  this location.  Always great service and good food.  On today the service is kinda lacking.  But I still got my usual.

I loved the variety in the menu and the atmosphere of the restaurant. We were greeted and were checked up on quite frequently. The place was packed because it was lunch time but we still managed to get great service. I ordered soup and salad (I was on a diet, LOL) and my friends ordered their pies. Everything was delicious.  My only downside was the portion sizes. My plate was as wide as a sun hat but had a weird concave bowl part for soup in the middle. *insert confused girl meme here*. They use the illusion of the plate to distract portion size.

Eh  is my official review.   Service was excellent.  Waiter was friendly, fast and nice. Recommended coupon that saved me five dollars.  Dumplings were overcooked. Avocado eggrolls were OK I might neat them again.Guacamole appetizer was also OK but not amazing.   Overall it was a ho-hum experience. Won't be rushing back there

Very disappointing SMALL PORTIONS server here .  I left this Resturant so hungry after I already ate my meal most places I'm always bring some of my meal to take home not here though.  I could have eaten 2 or 3 times what I was served here. I ordered cedar plank salmon the asparagus was cold and most of all the PORTIONS  ARE SMALL best to come here if you want to blow $50.00 on you and a date for a snack sized dinner meal they should Advertise that their menu is a kiddie menu because that's what you get an appetizer sized meal. Next time I'll go to Pieology  and be Full for under $9.00  I should have spend $50.00 on Pieology then I would have went home with 1 pizza in my belly 1 Pizza for my date and 6 Pizzas to take home with us! For a more nicer type Resturant in Somerset Mall you think they'd  shell out for a little more food to be served up.

Overall moderately average. 15 minute wait was a little inconvenient for our hunger. Took tooooooo long to bring bring and water to the table. We were starved and parched. Pizza: okay. Salad: okay. nothing exciting. My taste buds weren't tingling. Overall experience: okay. but if ur hungry after a long day of spending all ur moolah, this is the place.

My first experience here was awesome, the food was great but our server Stephanie was seriously amazing, I felt like I've known her for years, she was so sweet and never let my drink go empty, it's super rare to find such a genuine server now a days that actually care. We will be back!

I'm a first timer here at CK. I ordered a pizza with chicken, lettuce mix, avocado and tomato with a delicious white sauce. I can't remember the name but it is so amazing. Best pizza I've had in my life! My sister got the garlic Alfredo with shrimp and that was delicious as well!  It was my sisters birthday and out Waiter overheard us talking about it and brought out a AMAZING sundae with a candle on top! What a guy. I will 100% eat here every time I come back for a day of shopping at the Somerset!

I hate when people only provide a review on Yelp when things are bad, so let me say this:  I ate at this same CPK in August and we had a fantastic meal.  Great service, excellent food, and a great atmosphere.  My daughter loved it so much that she was anxious to come back, and we relented even though we really didn't want CPK today.   Unfortunately, she wasn't given the opportunity to eat there today because the service was so bad.  After waiting nearly 10 minutes to be seated (even though we were the second group in line and there were many empty tables), we waited at our table for almost 20 minutes.  No one came by.  No one asked about drinks.  And there didn't even appear to be much activity near us in terms of wait staff.  The employees we did see (most of them anyway) weren't hustling, and it was obvious that no one cared about the customer experience today.  We were hesitant to sit after the entry wait, concerned that it would be the same level of service once we sat down. Unfortunately, we were right.  With no one even meandering through our section, we finally gave up and decided to leave rather than start the dining experience nearly 30 minutes after entering the restaurant. There were a number of empty tables.  It wasn't a slow day, to be sure, but it wasn't a mall Saturday, either.  I suspect they just didn't have the staffing to handle the tables, but the answer to that is not to sit people and let them know up front where things stand. Just abysmal service.  My daughter was so sad because she loves the place.  Fortunately, we were able to find a nearby establishment interested in our business.

Disappointing.  Haven't been to one of these in a while so we thought we would try it again. The pizza's were sad, and lacked taste.  We had the California Club..some chunks of bacon and chicken with a bag of lettuce tossed over it and some mushroom thing which was just that...just a pile of sliced mushrooms on a pizza base. Maybe the mall sites are worse than the ones on their own but will bot be returning

Service not great. Sat at the bar during a weekday lunch hour and my water and drinks were not refilled. I was basically ignored most of my visit. They werent that busy either, lots of tables open. Would not recommend.

This was my first visit to California Pizza Kitchen and I had an okay time. At 2pm, we thought we would be able to get a table quickly. This was not the case. Oh well, we waited about 15 min which allowed us time to install the CPK app for a free "small plate". I felt like the service was a little slow here. Our waiter, Travis, was very friendly and patient. After we ordered, we expected to get the complimentary bread soon after. I was starving so I really wanted to eat something quick. However, after waiting for about 15 min, we decided to ask for it. After we did, it came shortly. For our free small plate, we got a shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread. This was the perfect size - four pieces for the four of us. It was quite tasty as well and super cute! We ordered the California club pizza, which is first baked with bacon, chicken, and cheese, and then topped with a salad, basil, and avocado. I found that the basil was too much as they were literally placed almost whole on top. I like basil, though, so it was ok for me, but I can imagine others not feeling the same. I really liked this pizza! We also got a White pizza and added bacon for $1.59. This was also quite good, very cheesy. I found that these pizza crusts got chewy and hard and difficult to eat after it got cold. We also got the fish taco. It only came with 2 tacos, some salsa, and chips. The fish was mahi-mahi and was quite good, obviously good quality fish. The portion was quite small for the price. I love coleslaw though, so this was pretty good for us to share. Overall, food was good and service was good. For a chain restaurant, I would say it met my expectations. I would definitely go again when I'm in the states and they had it somewhere nearby! Cheesecake Factory would be my choice before this place, though. Yay!
Probly the worst pizza I have ever had.   Tasted frozen but the bottom wasn't cooked.

Pretty good pizza? Been wanting to try for years. I would not have to go back as there are other places with much better pizza. Convenience is probably the biggest draw to this place? Just drop in while shopping & you don't even have to leave the mall? We had the Spinach & Artichoke Dip, the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad & the Sicilian Pizza, all of which were good. Their housemade ranch dressing was AWESOME! Place was decently clean. Service was OUTSTANDING! Katie was our server & just done a PHENOMENAL job! $lightly OVERpriced, for quality, but I gue$$ you have to pay for that convenience?

The food is typically good and I truly appreciate a restaurant that makes allergen information available to customers because my son is allergic to eggs. However, I only give 4 stars because of the inability to bring strollers into the restaurant. With strollers being as expensive as they are, I don't feel comfortable leaving mine unattended outside of the restaurant. I understand asking people to fold the strollers, but I should be able to keep it near my table.

I'm not a big fan of restaurant chains but CPK is the exception. I've been to multiple locations across the country and CPK is always consistently good, clean, and friendly. This location was no different. The hummus is the best appetizer, it's always good. Their tortilla soup is warming to the soul but not too spicy. And the roasted veggie salad is one of my all time favorite salads ever. It's full of chunky, flavor, and veggies. I think it's reasonably priced, good drinks as well, and friendly staff.

It's a very busy CPK. There's a long 20-25 min wait that you have to put your name in for. It's like that most weekends.  The good thing is that it's in a mall and you can occupy yourself with other things. They started a new system that texts and calls you when the table is ready so it makes it much nicer. It's an updated store since it's a pilot location. For food I normally get the jambalaya or the Kung pao spaghetti. Both are good not great. A bit too much overpowering flavor on both. The pizzas are good but I do t find them filling enough for me. Prices feel a bit high for the value you get, but maybe they are going for a more upscale price point. My major annoyance with CPK is the bread. First you have to ask to get it served. Then they give about one slice of a baguette per person. I want bread, not bread crumbs! Aside from that though, the restaurant is always busy for good reason. The food is solid and the location can't be beat.

I love CPK, and I know my bf and everybody else thinks I'm crazy, but I really do love it!!! Pros: -chicken tequila fettucine: SOOOO good. -spinach artichoke dip: the best I've ever had. -they offer coke products! -great service: today, my party of 1 (haha, so sad. I didn't know the mall opened til 12pm on Sundays.. -_-) dined at the bar, where Jenny kept me company and made some light conversation with me.  I always love talking to people, so I really enjoyed the company :) She was also prompt to refill my drink take my order. -I don't know if I'm crazy or what (or maybe just perpetually homesick), but I love looking at the artwork/pix on the wall...I honestly think at least 1-2 of them are images taken in San Diego! Cons: -this is an overall CPK con, not this particular location, but portion sizes have decreased dramatically since I started dining at CPK. -very busy location, so you may have a long wait, but just plan accordingly -they don't really give out much bread.  This isn't a biggie for me bc I don't like to eat the bread anyways..it's filler food, people!
This has always been one of my favorite restaurant chains. I'v been going there for over  15 years and there isn't much that I don't like on the menu. I highly recommend CPK to everyone.

Not the best visit we've ever had. I have been to this location many any times. Usually the service is great. Our servers in the past have been quite attentive, checks in to see if we need anything during the meal, after the meal. Grabs dishes that have piled up. Refills on drinks.  You know the drill. On Sunday we had Mary. Now while she was friendly and helpful in taking our orders there seemed to be a lacking component of follow up. The kids meals came first. My mom ordered a salad and I had soup. It took a full 20+ minutes before our items came to the table. By then the kids were done eating their pasta. She noticed their drinks were empty at that point but made no special trip in between to see if we needed anything or to even let us know about the delay in our meals. Once we were done we sat there. We watched people come and go. We watched people being served. But Mary was everywhere else. Anywhere else. We finally had to flag her down to order dessert and get our check. I still had to ask her to remove some of the excess plates on the table. This is not typical by any means. We have eaten here many many times as I've said before and never experienced slow service or a server who has forgotten us. Yes we've been here during madhouse busy hours as well as low peak hours. This was just not our best experience.
Great food. OK prices. Friendly service. Wait times can be a little long even when doing carry out. It nice that you can call ahead and just pick up though.

So I have waited for two weeks to write this review to give them a fair chance. I had ordered a takeout where I specifically told them (multiple times) to leave the chicken out when making the salad (which btw costs 15 bucks for god knows what). Looks like the chef forgot and put it in anyway and at the last moment removed it. When I opened it, there were little pieces of chicken in it. This has happened to me in other places and I understand that not many people ask to leave the meat out. When I called the manager, he refused to cancel the order (the other places have offered to do that) and would only allow me to pick up another one. On top of that he definitely was talking down to me like I was lying or something. I did not have the time to go back and he said he will drop in a gift card instead and took down my address. Two weeks later, I am still waiting for my gift card and paid $15 for food I could not eat. Their ethics sucks and I will never go back.

Excellent food in every CPK I've ever been to.. The menu is creative and has a wide variety of tasty bites. The service at this location is also great. However, the tables are too close to each other and it is always busy.. Wait times...  My favorite meal is the BBQ chicken chopped salad or the Spicy Chipotle chicken pizza.  They also have nice mixed drinks and martinis. I did try the Carnitas tacos once and they were dry and unsatisfying..  I do believe this was a rare occasion but wouldn't order them again. I feel the menu is also a little overpriced.  Overall.. One of my favorite places to eat!

I have not been here in years but I was surprised they still have really good food. I had the roasted vegetable salad with chicken and it was really good. The perfect portion size too.  Service was kind of slow considering they were not busy.  Drinks are pricey.

Had dinner here with my wife. Got seated quickly and service was very prompt, except that they forgot the bread at first. We had the Thai salad and the California vege pizza. The salad was excellent, the peanut butter dressing was very tasty and everything felt fresh and crunchy. The pizza was great too, especially loved the corn. It could have used a little more seasoning though. Otherwise great dinner at CPK.

I havent been to a cpk in 3-4 years and i heard they made it more upscale. I was never a big fan but I once had a gf who was really into the tostada pizza so we would eat it from time to time. While the interior is certainly much nicer, gone are the ugly 80's lemon yellow paint and in is the new sleek rustic wood nightclub look.   However the pizza is garbage. I will preface it by saying after a trip to naples a couple years ago my pizza palette was refined. There are two categories; good and basically frozen s$@!. CPK falls into the later, the tostada tasted like taco bell leftovers thrown on a slice of bread. Basically vomit in my mouth. The only saving grace was they has a salted carmel pudding dessert that was pretty good and there was a waitress that is an incredible doppelgänger for Kristen Stewart that I could not keep my eyes off of.

My bf & I were seated immediately around dinner time because we weren't a large group. There was a large group waiting to be seated outside when we arrived, though. The service was fine, and the food was standard CPK food. I did notice that the prices seemed a bit steeper than other CPK's I've been to. Ah well, I guess that's Somerset for you.

Please go to CPK immediately and order a bowl of the Farmers Market Soup (a wonderful squash based veggie medley). Yes, yes - the name is bad and a bit cliche but overlook it and order. It was the best soup I've had in years.  Squash soup with carrots, corn and other fine vegetable friends. Mmmmmmmm nutrients.  Oh and of course the pizza was fine. The service was fine and the total cost was just a bit too much.  That's how it goes at CPK.

We came on Valentine's Day, so we expected it to be crowded. Only a 20 minute wait and then we got seated. I had a Raspberry Lemon Martini, which was the strongest drink I've EVER had. And on an empty stomach? Whoa... We started with the Waldorf Salad and it was delicious, especially the sweet glazed pecans. I had the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine and it was sooo good! Crisp tender ribbons of zucchini and yummy shrimp. A pasta dish at a restaurant for 550 calories? Yep.  He had the Hawaiian pizza which was good but not great. A little too charred on the bottom. Service was good, but not great. We will be back.

I love coming here with friends. The food comes out fast. My only complaint is that sometimes it can get a little too salty -- especially the jambalaya shrimp pasta.  The pizza you can probably finish by yourself, but if you want to split it with a friend, it's doable as well.  I love that they partner with schools for fundraisers.

Best CPK in the greater Detroit area. Food is always prompt and fresh. This place is a favorite for families as the kids meals are a great value, especially with the deserts. If you appreciate good service, Sean will take great care of you.

Best location and plenty of room. This CPK location also has seating with the Mall view and it is amusing to sit there savoring your soup while watching kids run around . The Pizza is in the name but their Soups and Salads are the best. Don't miss the appetizers also called small plates.

The bread they give at the beginning is so tasty. I've been eating here couple of times, the waitress was really nice and took my order really carefully since I'm really picky with what's on my food. It took about 20minutes to get it, it was worth the wait! If you ever been in Italy, this restaurant is a lot similar!

I've been going to this California Pizza Kitchen for about 9 years now, and I have never been disappointed.
